title: Malthusian theory and high birth rates

content.prompt: Malthusian theory would explain which of the following possible consequences of high birth rates in a less developed country?

choices.label: Famine and starvation will occur as demand outpaces agricultural production.
Technological advancements will lead to increased agricultural production.
People will implement family-planning methods as resources grow scarce.
Areas with the greatest population density will import scarce resources.
Farmers will bring more land under cultivation to produce more food.

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain spatial relationships in a specified context or region of the world, using geographic concepts, processes, models, or theories.
